content: what is  Find a js geo project to contribute to (mapbox? Leaflet?)?

Both Mapbox and Leaflet are great options for contributing to JavaScript Geo projects. Here's a brief overview of each:

1. Mapbox: Mapbox offers a range of open-source tools and libraries for building custom maps and geospatial applications. You can contribute to their core JavaScript library called "mapbox-gl-js," which powers interactive, customizable maps. It's written in JavaScript and allows for rendering of geospatial data in the browser using WebGL. You can find their projects on GitHub and look for issues labeled as "help wanted" or "good first issue" to get started.

2. Leaflet: Leaflet is a lightweight, open-source JavaScript library for building interactive maps. It provides a smooth and user-friendly experience across different platforms and devices. Leaflet has a vibrant community and a wide range of plugins/extensions, which you can contribute to based on your interests. Their GitHub repository is a great place to explore issues and projects where you can contribute.

Apart from these, there are other JavaScript Geo projects you can consider, such as OpenLayers (a feature-rich library for building web-based maps), Turf.js (a modular geospatial analysis library), Cesium.js (a 3D mapping library), and D3.js (a powerful data visualization library with geospatial capabilities). All of them offer opportunities for contribution and have active communities you can join. Good luck!
